article.author: Kevin Parlon
article.title: What explains the appallingly low Covid vaccination targets set by Ireland?
article.text:
brughahaha said:
Worse , they were offered a second bite of the cherry with an additional 500 million doses (which would bring us up to about 80%) but the French didnt want a German company getting so much money and demanded the money be spent on a French company, Sanofi who are unlikely to have a vaccine before 2022 But dont expect to read any articles criticising the enormous slow lethargic and incompetent overpaid bureaucracy in Brussels in the irish media .....like the church before it , it is considered sacrosanct and beyond scrutiny or criticism Maybe in September when Ireland is going into yet another lockdown while the US and UK remain open as they have administered sufficient vaccines while we hover at 20% , questions might start to be asked ....but i doubt it

Corona: Germany and Europe Could Fall Short on Vaccine Supplies

The EU and Berlin have insisted there will be sufficient vaccine available, but delays in signing purchasing contracts mean that the elixir will arrive late and there might not be enough. The EU even declined an option that would have allowed for the purchase of hundreds of millions of extra doses.
www.spiegel.de
Click to expand...
Well, there's the headshot. The sclerotic lumbering bureaucratic hulk that is the EU put optics ahead of people's lives. They wanted a "synchronized" roll out. Meaning even if one country could have taken deliveries earlier, they were to wait so Ursula VDL could have her "From Riga to Lisbon" moment. They put politics in front of people's lives. Tiny Israel will have all of their over 60's vaxxed by the end of January. 2,857 vaccinations a day in a world where 150,000 is possible (you just need to organize) is criminal mismanagement.
 
When our friendless standard was first unfurled, who were the strangers who first mustered around our staff? And when it reeled in the fight, who more brilliantly sustained it than Erin's generous sons? - George Washington
